title: Isolate the Quadratic term
text: We add $$2$$ on both sides to get $$5{\left(b+2\right)}^2$$ by itself which gives $$5{\left(b+2\right)}^2=120$$.
speech: We add  2  on both sides to get  5 times, parentheses b plus 2,  squared  by itself which gives  5 times, parentheses b plus 2,  squared is equal to 120 .

title: Find Leading Coefficient
pacedSpeech: What's the leading coefficient now?

title: Make the Leading Coefficient "1"
text: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives $${\left(b+2\right)}^2=24$$.
speech: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives  parentheses b plus 2,  squared is equal to 24 .
pacedSpeech: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives    b plus 2,  squared is equal to 24

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(b+2\right)}^2=24$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$b+2=\sqrt{24}$$ or $$b+2=-\sqrt{24}$$.

title: Find $$b$$ in $$b+2=-\sqrt{24}$$
text: What is $$b$$ when $$b+2=-\sqrt{24}$$? Simplify the square root as much as possible.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$5{\left(b+2\right)}^2-2=118$$ has two solutions which are $$x=-2\sqrt{6}-2$$, and $$x=2\sqrt{6}-2$$.
speech: Therefore,  5 times, parentheses b plus 2,  squared minus 2 is equal to 118  has two solutions which are  x, is equal to negative 2 the square root of 6 minus 2 , and  x is equal to, 2 the square root of 6 minus 2 .
